intro: Oxydectes desertorum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows low to the ground, with hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves adapted to conserve water. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oxydectes desertorum is well-suited to harsh environments, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
